title: `feature(associated_const_equality)` allows const arguments to generic const parameters

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
### Code ```Rust pub trait TraitWAssocConst { const A: T; } fn main>() {} ``` ```Rust #![feature(generic_const_exprs)] #![allow(incomplete_features)] pub trait TraitWAssocConst { const A: dyn TraitWAssocConst; } fn bar>() {} ``` ### Meta Both code snippets ICE on the following version as we added an assert that we do not support arguments to generic const parameters `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (7aa413d59 2023-02-19) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7aa413d59206fd511137728df3d9e0fd377429bd commit-date: 2023-02-19 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` The first code snippet ICEs before we added that assertion `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (8996ea93b 2023-02-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 8996ea93b6e554148c4286e62b613f12a3ee505c commit-date: 2023-02-09 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output for the first code snippet on stable: ``` error[E0658]: associated const equality is incomplete --> src/lib.rs:5:35 | 5 | fn main>() {} | ^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #92827 for more information ```
Backtrace on new rustc
